item.title: Robert add a quote by Jessica Mitford
item.description: "You may not be able to change the world, but at least you can embarrass the guilty." -- Jessica Mitford

item.title: Robert add a quote by Jessica Mitford
item.description: "Objectivity? I always have an objective. " -- Jessica Mitford

item.title: Robert add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robert add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "He writes the worst English that I have ever encountered. It reminds me of a string of wet sponges; it reminds me of tattered washing on the line; it reminds me of stale bean soup, of college yells, of dogs barking idiotically through endless nights. It is so bad that a sort of grandeur creeps into it. It drags itself out of the dark abysm of pish, and crawls insanely up the topmost pinnacle of posh. It is rumble and bumble. It is flap and doodle. It is balder and dash. <i>(writing about US President Warren G. Harding)</i>" -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Robert add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Writing is easy. All you have to do is cross out the wrong words." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robert add a quote by Wayne Gretzky
item.description: "You miss one hundred percent of the shots you don't take." -- Wayne Gretzky

item.title: Robert add a quote by Robert Heinlein
item.description: "What are the facts? Again and again and again – what are the facts? Shun wishful thinking, ignore divine revelation, forget what “the stars foretell,” avoid opinion, care not what the neighbors think, never mind the unguessable “verdict of history” – what are the facts, and to how many decimal places? You pilot always into an unknown future; facts are your single clue. Get the facts!" -- Robert Heinlein

item.title: Robert add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "To hold a pen is to be at war." -- Voltaire
